BTC ขึ้นและ L1s ลงเมื่อกระแสเงินกลับมาสับสนอีกครั้ง

BTC is up and L1s are down as flows turn messy again

12/13/2025//Kunal Doshi
bitcoin
AI

Summary

TH

ตลาดแสดงผลการเบี่ยงเบนในเมื่อวานนี้ โดยทองคำ บิทคอยน์ (BTC) และ S&P 500 มีผลตอบแทนเป็นบวก ในขณะที่ Nasdaq ลดลง ในตลาดคริปโต การเคลื่อนไหวไม่สม่ำเสมอ โดย Crypto Miners นำการเติบโตด้วยผลตอบแทน 4.5% ตามด้วย DeFi ที่เพิ่มขึ้น 1.93% ในขณะที่ DePIN ลดลง 3.2% และ L1s มีผลลบ -2.5% แม้ BTC จะมีผลลบเป็นบวก แต่โทเคน L1 ส่วนใหญ่ก็ยังด้อยกว่า โดย SEI และ BERA ลดลง 9% การไหลเข้าของ ETF ยังเป็นอุปสรรค โดย ETF ของ BTC และ ETH มีการไหลออก 154.2 ล้านดอลลาร์และ 42.3 ล้านดอลลาร์ตามลำดับในขณะที่ ETF ของ SOL ยังคงดึงดูดการลงทุนอย่างต่อเนื่อง

EN

The market showed divergence yesterday with gold, BTC, and S&P 500 posting gains while Nasdaq fell. In crypto, performance was uneven as Crypto Miners led with a 4.5% gain, followed by DeFi at 1.93%, while DePIN declined 3.2% and L1s underperformed at -2.5%. Despite BTC being in the green, most L1 tokens struggled, with SEI and BERA both falling 9%. ETF flows remain a challenge as BTC and ETH products saw significant outflows of $154.2M and $42.3M respectively after recent inflows, while SOL ETFs continue to attract consistent capital.

Key Points

  • Market divergence with BTC, gold, and S&P 500 gaining while Nasdaq fell
  • Crypto sector uneven performance with Miners (+4.5%) and DeFi (+1.93%) outperforming DePIN (-3.2%) and L1s (-2.5%)
  • ETF flows challenging as BTC and ETH products see outflows while SOL ETFs maintain inflows

Article

This is a segment from the 0xResearch newsletter. To read full editions, subscribe . Performance across major assets diverged yesterday. Gold, BTC, and the S&P 500 posted gains of 0.95%, 0.55%, and 0.39%, respectively, while the tech-heavy Nasdaq slipped -0.12%. The divergence was driven largely by Oracle, whose shares fell -11% after disappointing quarterly revenues and higher spending guidance. That miss reignited concerns around the durability of the AI trade and sparked a rotation out of tech and into lagging parts of the market, pushing the Dow Jones Industrial Average to fresh highs. Crypto sector performance echoed the uneven tape. Despite renewed skepticism around AI, Crypto Miners were the standout performers, rising 4.5% on the day. IREN, which makes up 24% of the index, gained 4.4% and helped lead the move. DeFi followed with a 1.93% gain, driven by strength in AAVE, ENA, and HYPE, which together account for 44% of the index and all closed higher. On the downside, DePIN continued to struggle, falling -3.2%. The sector was dragged lower by FIL and GRASS, which dropped -6.2% and -7.2%, respectively. L1s were another surprise laggard, down -2.5% on the day. Even with BTC in the green, most L1 constituents finished lower, with SEI and BERA both posting losses of -9%. Flows remain a headwind. After a strong $346.2 million day of ETF inflows on Dec. 9, momentum faded again with both BTC and ETH ETFs seeing outflows of -$154.2 million and -$42.3 million, respectively, yesterday. The lone bright spot continues to be SOL ETFs, which are still attracting low single- to low double-digit millions in daily inflows. Get the news in your inbox.
